unit.title: Grammar in Action: Tenses & Prepositions
unit.overview: Learners consolidate control of simple tenses and common prepositions in real contexts. Lessons are interactive and short to reduce fatigue, with AI correction activities, XP hooks, and British English usage. Moral focus: speak and write truthfully and clearly.
competencies: Use simple present, past, and future accurately in everyday contexts.
Recognise common time expressions that signal tense (every day, yesterday, tomorrow).
Use common prepositions of time and place (at, on, in; at school, on Monday, in Accra).
Edit short paragraphs to fix tense shifts and preposition errors.
Write a cohesive 6–8 sentence paragraph using correct tenses and prepositions.
values_morals: Respect your reader: choose precise time/place expressions.

lessons.title: Simple Tenses Review (Present–Past–Future)
objectives: Identify and use simple present, past, and future with key time markers.
Avoid common errors in British English spelling (e.g., travelled, labelled).
lessons.moral_link: Be consistent—do not switch tenses without reason.

content_blocks.body: Signal words: every day/usually (present), yesterday/last week (past), tomorrow/next year (future).

fill_blanks.prompt: Choose the correct tense using signal words.

items.text: Every Monday, Ama __ (visit/visited/will visit) the library.
Yesterday, the class __ (clean/cleaned/will clean) the lab.

ai_task.prompt: Rewrite these three sentences so their tenses match a timeline (past → present → future).

lessons.title: Prepositions of Time (at/on/in)
objectives: Use at/on/in with times, days/dates, and months/years correctly.

vocabulary.definition: A word linking a noun to another word (time, place, etc.).

lessons.moral_link: Precision shows respect for your reader’s time.

content_blocks.caption: Time prepositions: at 7:30, on Monday, in October.

content_blocks.body: at + clock time / holiday period (at Christmas); on + day/date; in + month/year/season.

drag_drop.prompt: Place each phrase under at, on, or in.

quick_check.q: Choose the correct option: We meet __ Friday.

lessons.title: Prepositions of Place (at/in/on)
objectives: Use at/in/on accurately for place (at school, in Accra, on the table).
Recognise fixed phrases common in British usage.
lessons.moral_link: Be clear about place to avoid confusion.

content_blocks.caption: Place prepositions: at a point, in an area/volume, on a surface.

content_blocks.body: at school/home/work; in Accra/Ghana/a car; on the bus/table/floor; on TV/radio (idiomatic).

vocab_in_context.q: Yaw lives __ Accra but studies __ Kumasi.

ai_task.prompt: Write three sentences about your school using at/in/on correctly (e.g., 'We eat at the canteen').

lessons.title: Edit for Tense Shifts & Prepositions
objectives: Identify and correct tense shifts in a short paragraph.
Fix preposition errors to improve clarity and correctness.

vocabulary.definition: Changing tense without a logical reason.
Keeping to the same tense or pattern unless change is needed.

lessons.moral_link: Consistency reflects integrity—keep your story steady.

content_blocks.body: Keep the timeline steady unless you signal a change with clear time words.

error_hunt.text: Yesterday we clean the classroom and we will place the chairs on the corner. Then Ama says she will help now.
tasks: Fix tense to simple past for yesterday events.
error_hunt.solution_hint: Use past forms: cleaned, said; on → in the corner; will help now → helped.

ai_task.prompt: Paste a short paragraph from your own writing. Ask the AI to flag tense shifts and preposition issues, then rewrite it clearly.

lessons.title: Apply It: A Clear Narrative Paragraph
objectives: Write a 6–8 sentence narrative paragraph with correct tenses and prepositions.
Use time markers and place phrases to guide the reader.

vocabulary.definition: The order in which events happen.
A word that signals time or place (yesterday, at school).

lessons.moral_link: Be truthful and specific in your storytelling.

content_blocks.body: Underline time markers and circle prepositions as you draft.

scaffold: Opening with time and place (e.g., Yesterday at the library, …)
Event 3 with a reason or result

quiz_mcq.q: Choose the correct tense: 'Every day, the prefects __ the hall.'
Pick the correct option: 'We arrived __ 7:30 a.m.'
Select the correct preposition: 'Yaw lives __ Kumasi.'
Which sentence avoids an unnecessary tense shift?
options: We cleaned the lab and we present the report.
We cleaned the lab and presented the report.

quiz_mcq.q: Which time marker signals the future?
Which sentence uses place prepositions correctly?
options: Put the books in the table.
Put the books on the table by the window.

quiz_mcq.q: A good narrative paragraph should include:
options: Clear time markers, correct tenses, and precise places

writing_prompt.prompt: Write a narrative paragraph (6–8 sentences) about preparing for a school event. Include at least four time/place markers and keep tense consistent.

criteria.name: Tense Control
criteria.descriptor: Consistent simple tenses; changes signalled clearly.

criteria.name: Prepositions
criteria.descriptor: Accurate at/on/in for time and place; correct idioms.
